messages.message:
Smart people, is this a problem: "(i)	No Open Source Software, or Software licensed to Company by any other Person, is included in or embedded in, or required for Customer to use, operate or otherwise exercise their rights with respect to, any Software or Services provided by Company hereunder.  No component or other portion of any Software provided to Customer contains any Open Source Software or other code that would create any obligation for Customer to (a) grant to any third party any Intellectual Property Right or other proprietary rights; (b) disclose or make any source code or any part or derivative work thereof available to third parties under any circumstances; or (c) otherwise subject Customer to any obligations not expressly set forth in this Agreement.
"
Where is this from? Seems like an impossible ask... even asking them to run on a linux-based operating system may be barred by this clause (i.e. required for Customer to use or operate)
If this is related to Sales, it should probably be reviewed by an actual lawyer...
is what they are saying that they want all of our code to be GPL complaint, as in all the software we use is free for us to distribute without any licensing?

Its about protecting their butts on the concept we use a software library or something that wasnt allowed to be modified or shared in the manner we are using it and say.... Facebook comes after us... (Facebook changed their Licensing on their open source sofrware after it allowed that behavior)  https://medium.freecodecamp.org/facebook-just-changed-the-license-on-react-heres-a-2-minute-explanation-why-5878478913b2

We should ask them to remove the first sentence that says customers are not required to use any open source software when running instabase (which is false). The second sentence should be ok - none of the code/open source libraries we used subject our customers to any obligations.
